tool.name: Split scaffolds
tool.description: in separate sequences when long N-runs are detected.

param.name: locus_tag
param.label: Locus Tag
param.help: Please specify a locus_tag prefix, it must be at least 3 characters.

tool.help:
**What it does**
NCBI does not accept sequences with gaps in it. Scaffold on the other hands can have large amounts of N-runs in it. These script, remove all N-runs and creates an additional sequence out of it. The scaffold can be saved in a special format (AGP). That file is required for NCBI submission. If the resulting contig has a length lower than 200, we skip it.
**Params**
- Locus Tag That tag should be the same you specified in scaffold2fasta tool, if you used it. It's an prefix for your unique sequence ID's.
- Sequence Description The sequence description will be inserted in each FASTA header and will be included in the genbank file. The NCBI reviever suggested something like [organism=Glarea lozoyensis 74030] [strain=74030]. For prokaryotic genes it meight be good to change the genetic code to something specific. For example [organism=Streptomyces viridochromogenes Tue494] [strain=Tue494] [gcode=11]
